node.title: Parisa left Afghanistan utterly 'empty'. Now, she's rebuilding her life in Melbourne
node.alt: A photo of Parisa wearing a purple headscarf (hijab) with her laptop infront of her.
node.description: Clothes, toothbrushes and everyday necessities donated by communities and essential services are helping thousands of Afghan evacuees in Melbourne resettle, after the Taliban takeover in August.
node.content:
["Nearly three\u00a0months after fleeing Afghanistan through Kabul's besieged Hamid Karzai airport, Parisa\u00a0is slowly making a new life for herself in Australia.", "The university scholar made the heartbreaking decision to leave her parents and life\u00a0in Afghanistan as the Taliban took control.", "\"I lost everything I had. Everything I achieved and fought for,\" Parisa said.", "\"It was really hard for me to accept that I would not have any career after [the Taliban takeover]. I cannot have my job. I cannot have my studies.", "Footage of people thronging Kabul's international airport, desperate to leave the country, were beamed around the world.", "\"I never thought I would leave Afghanistan like that,\" she said.", "Parisa, who doesn't want her full name used,\u00a0spent several days\u00a0pushing first to get through the airport's gates and then onto an evacuation flight.", "\"The Taliban were hitting people. They are firing and, you know, the children crying there because they were really afraid,\" she said.", "\"Everyone was tired there because there was no place to sit, there was no place so you could rest. And you have to stand there for two days or three days.", "\"The weather was really hot, and I saw the children die because the atmosphere was terrible.", "Eventually, Parisa boarded a flight, first to Dubai, then eventually to Melbourne via quarantine in Darwin.", "\"When I entered the plane, and I felt that I'm leaving Afghanistan, I just felt empty,\" she said.", "\"I'm not just leaving the country, I'm leaving my 20 years and leaving all I had.", "\"It's like \u2026 just the body leaving to Australia, but your heart and your soul is still in Afghanistan, and you're feeling like you're empty, going to Australia. That was a terrible feeling.\"", "Parisa\u00a0is\u00a0now living in safety at Melbourne's Monash University.\u00a0", "She\u00a0is one of more than 2,000 Afghan\u00a0evacuees who have arrived in Melbourne since August when\u00a0the Taliban swept to power.", "Many fled with just the clothes they were wearing, some managed to leave with their passports.", "
'A long journey'
", "", "
AMES chief executive Catherine\u00a0Scarth\u00a0says finding housing for the evacuees is top priority.\u00a0(ABC News: Nicole Asher)
", "Settlement support agency AMES Australia has been working with many of the evacuees.", "\"That 2,000 for us represented close to 50 per cent of our annual arrivals in about 15 days, on the back of remembering 18 months of virtually no arrivals at all because borders were closed,\" its chief executive Catherine Scarth said.", "AMES has provided material aid like clothes and even toothbrushes while helping people with identity documents, enrolling children in schools and housing.", "\"Finding them houses is obviously really important, and they're wanting to know about family back home in Afghanistan, and they're wanting to get onto a permanent visa here,\" Ms Scarth said.", "", "
AMES has had to respond quickly to provide clothing and basic necessities to thousands.(ABC News: Nicole Asher)
", "\"It's going to be a long journey for people.", "\"Ordinarily, people would have time to prepare, would know a little bit about Australia and what they're coming to.\"", "Ms Scarth said these refugees arrived with nothing but the clothes on their backs.", "\"We've had to respond incredibly quickly with not just the usual support that we'd provide but trying to find clothing and suitcases for people and shoes and everything you could imagine,\" she said.", "A silver lining delivered by the pandemic meant Melbourne had vacant accommodation usually occupied by international students.", "\"It's still not the same as your own home and space, but it's absolutely incredible,\" Ms Scarth said.", "\"I don't know what we would have done had that not been the case that we could use that accommodation.\"", "She urged anyone with a vacant investment property to consider making it available for the evacuees.", "", "
Donations have poured in from major retailers and the community.(ABC News: Nicole Asher)
", "\"The next big thing is people are just wanting to get their long-term housing secured, getting children into school \u2026 getting some work experience, learning English,\" she said.", "\"Obviously, many of the evacuees have terrific English because they were working with our forces.\"", "Donations have poured in from major retailers and the community.", "\"The Afghan community has been absolutely tremendous, delivering Afghan food, helping out with interpreting, providing appropriate clothing,\" she said.", "
Afghan community in Australia coming together
", "", "
Sitarah Mohammadi\u00a0says August was a painful time for the Afghan diaspora.(ABC News: Nicole Asher)
", "Sitarah Mohammadi was a child when her family fled Afghanistan, taking refuge first in Pakistan, before eventually settling in Melbourne's south-east.", "\"It's been very liberating to know that I live in a country and I have the freedoms and the liberties to dress the way, to speak the way and to express the way that I do,\" she said.", "She is studying at Monash Law School and spent 2019 on a scholarship at England's Oxford University.", "\"August 15th was probably one of the darkest periods for a lot of people, including the people in the diaspora like myself,\" Ms Mohammadi said.", "\"The Afghan community more broadly across Australia has been coming together. We've got the Action for Afghanistan campaign, which is sort of campaigning for more political asks.", "\"In terms of more community groups, people have been collecting donations financially and clothes, food, things like that, so there's been a big group of people that are working behind the scenes there to help those who have recently arrived here.\"", "In the wake of the Taliban takeover in Kabul, the Australian government announced it would allocate 3,000 humanitarian places for Afghan refugees, indicating that the number would rise.", "Humanitarian groups,\u00a0like Action for Afghanistan, have been arguing for that intake to be expanded by a dramatic degree.", "\"We've been asking for the government to increase that humanitarian intake from 3,000 to at least 20,000,\" Ms Mohammadi said.", "\"It would be worthwhile for the government to consider granting permanent protection for those refugees as they will not be able to return to Afghanistan under the rule of the Taliban,\" she said of people currently living in Australia on temporary protection visas.", "The Victorian government has recently announced almost a million dollars of funding to provide refugees with free legal assistance.", "Some of the funding will allow the\u00a0independent community legal centre, Refugee Legal, to work with pro bono lawyers from major firms and local multicultural communities.", "The rest of the grant will be shared by the\u00a0Afghanistan Legal Hotline and Legal Clinic.", "The services\u00a0provide advice on bringing family members to Australia and for those who have been refused refugee protection and\u00a0are seeking reassessment of their protection\u00a0claims.\u00a0", "Multicultural Affairs Minister Ros Spence said many Afghan Victorians continued to feel the effects of the terrible events unfolding in Afghanistan.", "\"This funding delivers more legal help for people dealing with the fallout of the situation there,\" she said.", "Meanwhile, the support from the community has not been lost on Parisa who is already looking to help those she has left behind.", "\"As an Afghan woman, Afghan girl, you're carrying this responsibility of the whole community, and you're responsible for the girls and women in Afghanistan,\" Parisa said.", "\"I'm planning to continue my education, which is very important for me, and I'm starting my job here.", "\"I have to train myself so I could help more girls.\""]
